intro: Freziera echinata, commonly known as the spiny freziera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
